dlgPart.npc_text:
Returning to Maadoran, you request an immediate audience with Lord of House Aurelian.
"It's better be good," says Gaelius, entering the throne room.

dlgAnsw.text: “I’ve just returned from Ganezzar.” Tell him what you saw.

dlgPart.npc_text: “So other than a man with glowing eyes you haven’t seen anything? No recently dug out engines of war, no new artefacts, no allies we know nothing about?”
“A room full of stars deep under the castle? It's an interesting oddity but hardly more than that. You haven't seen any recently dug out engines of war, new artefacts, allies we know nothing about?”

“And that's why House Crassus must be destroyed! Delenda est, as they used to say in the olden days. Still, it would take more than whispers in your mind to defeat our troops. You haven't seen any recently dug out engines of war, new artefacts, allies we know nothing about?”

“Very well. Travel to Caer-Tor without delay and talk to Dux Paullus. I want him to help us take Ganezzar.
“In exchange,” Gaelius sighs, reluctant to voice his thoughts, “in exchange, the Guards will become my military arm. The Charter will be abolished and all restrictions placed on them by my ancestors will be lifted.”

dlgAnsw.text: “What makes you think Paullus would agree?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “The Ordu are a potent weapon but I can’t use it yet, not against a city like Ganezzar and a rival House. People will not accept it. Even in war, there are rules of conduct.”

dlgAnsw.text: “What makes you think Paullus would agree?”

[intelligence success]“What if it was the Imperial Guards who attacked Ganezzar without provocation and you had no choice but to send the Ordu to stop them? Unfortunately, they arrived too late to save lord Meru.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Because he will not get a better offer and he knows it. I know what I’m asking for and I damn well know what I’m offering in return.”

dlgAnsw.text: “You think you can keep him in line once you remove all restraints?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“Trust me, I can handle Paullus. It’s Meru and whatever hell he might unleash tomorrow that I worry about.
“Besides, even if I find a way to take Ganezzar on my own, the Imperial Guards would have to be dealt with one way or another. So, either I fight them and this war will be long and costly or I make a deal with them. Might as well do it now and have them earn their place in the alliance.”

dlgAnsw.text: [intelligence success]“What if you use the Guards to take Ganezzar and then send the Ordu to deal with the Guards once and for all?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“You don’t want to be too clever, <charname>,” says Gaelius after a long pause, “you might outsmart yourself.
“If I follow your advice, I’ll lose the Ordu and weaken the Guards enough not to be a threat for at least a few years, but I’ll create an enemy that will never forget this betrayal. Sometimes, it’s best to pay a fair price to gain an ally than stab him in the back and gain an enemy for life.”

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion]“Powerful men will always have enemies, my Lord, but an opportunity like this cannot be missed. Think of what you will accomplish in the next few years if you rule supreme. The Guards might not even be an issue by then.”

[etiquette][streetwise]“My Lord, you’re driven by the noblest of intentions which do you much credit, but you underestimate Dux Paullus. By all accounts, the man is a snake who can’t be trusted. I say without the slightest doubt that he’ll start plotting against you the moment you welcome him into Maadoran.”

[trading]“But is the price fair? I understand the importance of taking Ganezzar but you give away too much. You can’t afford it at the moment. Use the Ordu to weaken the Guards and then negotiate a new deal. A fair deal. After all, what choice would they have?”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]“I thank you for your counsel but my decision is final.”
[success]“I thank you for your counsel, <master/mistress> <charname>. I’ll consider it while you make arrangements with Paullus.”
